DataElement.preferredDefinition: The tissue is adjacent to tissue for PAXgene fixation.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: An anatomical structure consisting of similarly specialized cells and intercellular matrix, aggregated according to genetically determined spatial relationships, performing a specific function._A system of proprietary reagents and supplies utilizing formalin-free solutions for the simultaneous preservation of histomorphology and biomolecules and the purification of RNA, DNA, miRNA, proteins, and phosphoproteins from the same sample._An anatomical structure consisting of similarly specialized cells and intercellular matrix, aggregated according to genetically determined spatial relationships, performing a specific function._Next to or adjoining.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: (TISH-oo) A group or layer of cells that are alike and that work together to perform a specific function.
